wikipedia_page.main: Sir Cecil Hamilton Armitage  (8 October 1869 – 10 March 1933) was a British colonial officer who served as Governor of the Gambia from 1920 to 1927. He established the Armitage School and the Gambia Department of Agriculture.

link_mentions.page: List of colonial governors of the Gambia
response: | rowspan="2" |Sir Cecil Hamilton ArmitageKBE CMG DSO(1869–1833)
* Cecil Hamilton Armitage (1869–1933), British colonial official in West Africa

The specific name, armitagei, is in honor of Cecil Hamilton Armitage (1869-1933), who collected the type specimen while he was Governor of the Gambia.Beolens, Bo; Watkins, Michael; Grayson, Michael (2011). The Eponym Dictionary of Reptiles. Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press. xiii + 296 pp. . (Chalcides armitagei, p. 11).
*Captain Cecil Hamilton Armitage, D.S.O., Chief Commissioner of the Northern Territories of the Gold Coast.

Armitage School is a high school in Janjanbureh, in the Gambia. It was established in 1927 by Governor Cecil Hamilton Armitage in Georgetown. After World War II, the school became a secondary boarding school.
*Captain Cecil Hamilton Armitage  Governor and Commander-in-Chief of the Colony of the Gambia
*Cecil Hamilton Armitage (1869–1933), Governor of the Gambia from 1921 to 1927
